Maybe I'm just a food snob since I moved to Houston, but with smaller and more original pizza joints in this city, I've kept my distance from these chain gangs.  Yes, they do have many unique pizzas and their salads are creative as well...but it still tastes, feels, looks like every other one in the country. The BBQ chicken pizza with honey wheat crust is always a good call...but I've since started making my own at home which is much more fun.  The Santa Fe chicken pizza is also very delicious....chicken, caramelized onions, guac, sour cream, and pico are all things that I want atop my dough.
Better than the average chain diner.  They just took my favorite Milano pizza off the menu though...:-( Be sure to order pizza, the kitchen doesn't do well with non-pizza orders.

We chose this restaurant as we wanted pizza before a movie at River Oaks Theatre. We could park once for both. We're not chain restaurant goers - we also ate at RDG and Boada's this week - but the food was good and the service was excellent. They even kept our leftovers until after the movie, and gave us the pizza hot. We'll go back if we want a meal before a movie.

Their service here is great, the servers are very nice and friendly. Their pizzas are delicious and come out fresh. Ordered a fresh strawberry mango cooler was a very refreshing and fizzy drink. This is a great restaurant to bring your family to. But, don't order a kids pizza they aren't topped with lot and are very boring. Other than that this is an awesome place to eat pizza.

I've always liked the food at CPK. Yes, this particular one is slow, but I was never sure if it was just the kitchen or all of the chains, because I know pizza is hard to get out quickly, even if it is thin crust. I went there last night with my boyfriend for dinner, expecting the same experience we'd had every time before: nice people, slow service, clean restaurant. We got everything except the cleanliness. We sat at the bar (after standing there for a good 30 seconds trying to figure out which place was dirty and which was clean) and finally took a chair that had a menu in it, hoping we hadn't stolen someone's seat. There were at least six glasses of varying fullness all over the bar, along with napkins and various other signs that someone had eaten there somewhat recently...or so I thought. The entire time that we were there, nobody made a single attempt to clear the bar off, and we were there for a good hour and a half. The bartender before had been a very attentive, very nice girl who actually looked like she didn't hate being at work. This guy was her antithesis. He seemed entirely unenthusiastic to be at work, didn't smile at us once and barely spoke loud enough to be heard. Honestly, this didn't bother me nearly as much as the dirty bar, but come on guys...you can do better!

Despite the fact that I am allergic to large chains, I enjoyed my meal at CPK. The food was fresh and tasty, I had a salad and the regular portion, as opposed to the large, was a lot of food. The service was good and they had a nice selection of wines by the glass. There is a large choice and the decor is very relaxing and quite classy.

CPK is what  it is, a chain with better food than most chains.  The menu is diverse so if your with a big group or if you can't make up your mind on what you want to eat the menu gives you plenty of options.  I've been coming here since the place opened and the service still hasn't come around.  The good thing is the food is consistent.  It is good every time I've been here.   What I like about CPK is when I don't want to have to think about dinner or lunch I can count on CPK to be there for me.  I guess that is my feeling with most chain restaurants.  CPK offers Pizza's, Salads, Pasta's, & Sandwich's so there is plenty to pick from.   The interior of this particular CPK doesn't look like any of the other chain CPK's I've been in, and its smaller.  Unfortunately Fayza is right on this one, parking sucks here.

Expect awful, slow service and pizzas that taste totally frozen. They did not refill our drinks and we waited in an empty restaurant for ONE HOUR for two pizzas. When they finally came out, mine came with bacon which I specifically asked them to remove because I am a vegetarian. I waited an additional 20 minutes for my pizza to be fixed. Meanwhile, my husband had finished his meal and had to wait for me. It was an awful experience and we will not be back. I can get their nasty frozen pizzas at the grocery store for half the price and time spent. Nothing special.

The pizza is very good and they have more than just pizza. The waiter service is acceptional beause they are usually busy and it is hard to get to you. It usually takes about 30 minutes to get your food, but it is worth the wait. The pizza is very good, but they should put a little bit more on the individual plates. Overall this is a very good pizza place to go to.
I'm glad this pizza open near me.  Good pizza, but best of all is their peach tea....yummy.....

I like this location waaaay better than the ones on Post Oak or in Mem City Mall. Its got a lot more space, not as loud and the service is good. This place always is consistent, so no complaints about the food. The pizzas, no matter which you get are just great. This is my preferred location and I'm sure I'll go again and again.

great service nice, nothing out of the norm kind of decor, clean feeling love their pizzas, so delicious. They also have pastas, apps, salads, etc. great management at this location love going back here! i always have a great experience!
Me and a couple friends came here for lunch. We got seated right away. The service was great and had a lot on the menu. I just had a pepperoni pizza. I know, boring!!! But it was good.

we headed over to this CPK location last night before watching the July 4th fireworks downtown. obviously, it was incredibly similar to the other locations i've been to...but i can't say i was dazzled in any way. i really enjoy he salads at CPK, so last night i tried the thai crunch with grilled chicken. it was pretty good, and i liked the addition of peanuts to the salad, but i also snuck a bite of a friend's BBQ chicken salad, which was incredibly disappointing. i have had the salad, along with the chinese chicken salad at other locations and liked it a good bit, but this one was bland and tasted nothing like BBQ chicken. the BBQ chicken pizza another friend ordered was decent, but nowhere near as good as Schlotsky's version of the same. all-in-all...not terrible but not great. i'm sure i'll be back if it's convenient to where i am headed for the day, but i doubt if i'll ever go out of my way to head to this location.
